csv_interface module

class csv_interface.CsvInterface(path: str | None)[source]

Bases: AddressDatabaseInterface

A class to interface with a CSV file for storing and retrieving address data. Handles reads, writes, and queries from/to a CSV file. It is also possible to use ths class without a CSV file, by simpliy interacting with the class without opening/saving to a file. The class inherits from AddressDatabaseInterface.

Parameters:

path (str | None) – The path to the CSV file.

Methods:

__enter__() → CsvInterface[source]

Enters the runtime context related to this object. This function is a warper for open() and not technically needed, for all files get closed imideatly after a read/write. It just enables the use of with CsvInterface ....

Returns:

The instance itself.

Return type:

CsvInterface

__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb) → None[source]

See __enter__(). Calls close(), therefore saving the current object to the file and resetting it.

Parameters:

  • exc_type

  • exc_val

  • exc_tb

Return type:

None

__init__(path: str | None)[source]

Initializes the CsvInterface. If a path is given, it is set and the file at the path gets opened loading its content as into object memory (in __df_memory).

Parameters:

path (str, optional) – the path to the CSV file

Return type:

CsvInterface

Turns the object istself in to an iteratable.

Returns:

The object itself, with an index set to 0

CsvInterface

__require_df_memory() → Callable

Class-specific decorator. Ensures that the object memory (__df_memory) is not None before calling the decorated function. If it is, a default value based on the function name is returne by the wrappe, instead of calling the function.

Parameters:

func (Callable) – the function to be decorated

Returns:

The wapper() which can return any

Return type:

Callable

__series_to_address() → Address

Converts a pandas.Series to an Address, ensuring all types are correct. Fails if the data series has an unexpected structure.

Parameters:

series (pd.Series) – the data series to convert

Returns:

the converted series as Address

Return type:

Address

close() → None[source]

Saves the current object memory to the file and then closes the CSV file. After this methode, the object is in an empty state with only the path set. A new path may be set or the file may be re-opened.

See save() for possible exceptions.

Return type:

None

delete(id__: int) → int | None[source]

Decorated by __require_df_memory(). Deletes the address with the given ID from objects memory.

Parameters:

id (int) – ID of the Address to delete

Returns:

The ID of the deleted address, or None if not found.

Return type:

int | None

get_all() → dict[int, Address][source]

Decorated by __require_df_memory(). Fetches all addresses from object memory.

Returns:

A dictonary with the key beeing the ID of the Address in the object memory

get_todays_birthdays() → dict[int, Address][source]

Decorated by __require_df_memory(). Fetches all addresses with today’s date as their birthday.

Returns:

A dictionary with the id and values of all address that have today set as their birthday

Return type:

dict[int, Address]

open() → None[source]

Reads the CSV file at the path set in set_path() or during construction into object memory (as class:pd.dataframes in __df_memory). While reading, the types of some columns in the csv fiele will get manualy converted, ensureing correct types in the object memory. If this conversion fails, the provided file is unusable and an exception occurs. After reading, the functuion will immediately closes the file.

Note: The function dose not verify the integrety of the whole file, thus when providing an invalid file errors may occure, other methodes, even after successfully loading the content into object memory.

See std.open() for all errors.

Raises:

  • IsADirectoryError – if the path is a directory

  • KeyError – if the file could be opened, but its content is invalid

Returns:

None, if successful.

Return type:

None

save() → None[source]

Saves the object memory into the CSV file at the path set in set_path() or during object creation. The file is opened in ‘a+’ mode.

See std.open() for possible exceptions.

Returns:

None, if saved successfully

Return type:

None

search(search_string: str) → dict[int, Address][source]

Decorated by __require_df_memory(). Searches for addresses that match the search string. The query can inclued any field of Address but should only include one. See detailed_csv_search for more information.

Parameters:

search_string (str) – The search term to look for

Returns:

a dictionary of {ID: Address} with all Addresses matchin the query. Empty if no matches where found.

Return type:

dict[int, Address]

set_path(path: str) → None[source]

Sets the path to the CSV file, checking if the path is valid. Changing the path to another file after reading from one is supported.

Parameters:

path (str) – the path to the CSV file

Raises:

KeyError – if the path is invalid

Returns:

None, if successful

Return type:

None

update(id__: int, **kwargs) → int[source]

Decorated by __require_df_memory() Updates an address by its ID using the provided kwargs. Known keys are all fields in Address. All unknown keys will be ignored.

Parameters:

  • id (int) – the ID of the address to update

  • kwargs (any) – key-value pairs of a field in address and its new value

Raises:

KeyError – if the given ID in not associated with any address

Returns:

the ID of the updated address

Return type:

int
